answers.explanation: Identify what creates true value for the customer.
Map all steps of the process and remove those that do not create value.
Ensure the work flows smoothly without interruptions or delays.
Produce only when there is actual demand from the customer.
Continuously improve processes to achieve maximum efficiency and quality.
Producing more than what is needed or before it is needed.
Idle time when resources or people are waiting for the next step.
Unnecessary movement of products or materials.
Performing more work or using more resources than required.
Excess raw materials, work-in-progress, or finished goods.
Unnecessary movements by people that do not add value.
Effort involved in inspecting, fixing, or redoing defective work.
